history.content: In general, you cannot transfer upper-division courses from community colleges. But to see if other UC's satisfy requirements, visit assist.org and select the appropriate year and requirements you want to transfer. I'm not sure whether Stat 134/140 can replace EE126, though I would err on the side of caution (maybe someone else can confirm?).

children.subject: I'm not an adviser, nor am I speaking on behalf of any advisers, but I believe that neither Stat 134 nor 140 cover random processes (i.e. Continuous-Time Markov Chains, Poisson Processes) in as much depth as 126. 126 also spends a lot of time on hypothesis testing and estimation in its latter half (e.g. Neyman-Pearson, Kalman Filter, MLE & MAP, Hilbert Space), which aren't really the focus of 134/140, since they are intended to be introductory classes in probability.

history.content:
Hello!

I wonder if there are courses that can satisfy the EECS minor upper-division courses, such as EECS 126 and EECS 127 in other institutions, such as community colleges or other UC, or other universities.

I was told EECS minor does not accept courses outside the EECS department, like Stats 140 or Stats 134 cannot replace EECS 126, is this correct?

Please let me know if there are equivalent courses to EECS 126 or EECS 127. Lots of thanks!
history.subject: EECS 126 or EECS 127 equivalent classes?
